old: おう、そっちはどうだ？　その後
column2: Hey, how's it going over there? What's been happening since then?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
魔物を倒すだけが覚者の仕事じゃあねぇ
あぁ、お前もそのうち分かるぜ
column2: Being able to defeat demons is not the only job of an Arisen, you know. Oh, you'll understand that soon.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
言い訳はなしだ、そんなもん考える前に
手と足を動かせよ
column2: No excuses, move your hands and feet before thinking about that.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
よう、ちょっとした賭けを――
いや、やめとくわ
column2:
Hey, want to make a little bet?
Nah, forget it.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
金をためてキノザの原泉近くに屋敷を建てるのよ
それが俺の目下の夢だ
column2: I'll save my money and build a mansion near Kinoza's spring. That's my current dream.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: ばかっ強い魔物と真っ向勝負して連戦連勝
column2: A series of head-to-head battles with the strongest demons and a series of victories.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
覚者になった頃はそれでおもしろおかしく
暮らしていけたが、もう、飽きちまった
――これから、どうするよ
column2: When I became an Arisen, I could live with that and have fun. But, I've grown tired now. What do I do from now on?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
刺激だぜ、刺激
俺が欲しいのはそれだ――やっとわかった
column2: It's exciting, so exciting. That's what I want―― I finally understand.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺はずっとはぐれ覚者のつもりでいたけどよ――
やっぱ、どっかで繋がってんだよな――ケッ！
column2: I've always thought of myself as a lost Arisen, but in the end, I guess there's some connection somewhere. Damn it!
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 柄にもねえこと言っちまったぜ
column2: I said something I shouldn't have.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
まあ、ボチボチやろうぜ
急ぐことはねえさ
column2:
Well, let's take it easy.
There's no rush.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
あんたの言うことにはなんだって従うつもりで
いるから賭け事禁止だけは言ってくれるなよ
column2: I intend to obey whatever you say, but don't tell me to stop gambling.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 俺をウソつきにしたくなかったらよ
column2: If you don't want to make a liar out of me
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 神殿にいる時くらい、いろんな奴と話しておけよ
column2: You should at least talk to a lot of people when you're in the temple.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺の見たところ、あんたに話しかけられると
どいつもこいつもうれしそうな顔になる
さぞ名誉なことに違いねえ
column2: From what I've seen, when you talk to them, everyone gets happy and they all have a delighted expression on their faces.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
ジョゼフのジジイは世の中がざわついている時の方が
いきいきして見えねえか？
column2: Doesn't Joseph's old man look more alive when the world is in turmoil?
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 魔物の一種かもしれねえぞ
column2: It might be a type of monster.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
はぁ――金がねえ――
負けた――
column2:
Huh... no money...
I'm screwed.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: あ？　なんだよ
column2: Huh? What's up?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
しかし――
なんだって俺が――
column2:
But--
what the hell am I--
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺も覚者の端くれだが
この場所は息が詰まるぜ
column2: I'm a bit of an Arisen man myself, but this place is suffocating.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
言うまでもねえが、俺は単純にガシガシと
戦うのが好きだ
column2: There's no need to say it, but I simply love a grueling fight.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
勝敗に金がかかってるのなんて最高だぜ
そんなわけだから、おまえ――
そういう場に、さっさと俺を行かせろよ
column2:
There's nothing like winning and losing with money on the line.
That's why you--
You better get me to that kind of place, and get on with it.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
侵食魔退治は俺に任せろ
ガシガシやっつけておくぜ
column2:
Leave the eradication of the Corruption to me.
I'll take care of it, no problem.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 俺はやっぱり戦場の男――
column2: I am a man of the battlefield.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
そう思ってきたが、こう無尽蔵にわくような
侵食魔と戦っていると心の奥底が
凍りつきそうになるぜ
永遠に続くのかよってな
column2: I have come to think so, but deep down in my heart, when I fight against the seemingly endless invading corruption, it feels as if my soul is about to freeze. Is this going to last forever?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
黒騎士を倒せば何もかも終わりじゃねえのかよ
あとはオマケみたいなものだろ？
column2:
I thought defeating the Black Knight was the end of everything.
The rest is kind of a bonus, right?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
島に出たみたいな奴がこれからの相手だとしたら
こっちもよっぽどの精鋭を揃えないと
やられちまうぜ
column2: If the guy who showed up on the island is our opponent from now on, we have to gather quite an elite team or we'll be done for
speaker: Gurdolin

old: レオの野郎――放って置いていいのか？
column2: That bastard Leo, can we afford to leave him alone?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
口ではなんと言おうと
奴はここでの立場――責任を捨てた男だ
このままじゃあ、スカッとしねえぞ
column2:
No matter what he says,
he's a man who has abandoned his position and responsibility here.
If things continue like this, it won't be satisfying in the least.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
さあどうするよ
ここでジッとしてるのが仕事か？
column2: What are we going to do? Is our job just to sit here and do nothing?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
セシリーが神殿に匿われていること――
黒騎士は知ってると思うか？
column2: Do you think the Black Knight knows that Cecily is being hidden in the temple?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺と話したって状況は何も変わらない
んなことは、わかってんだろう？
column2:
Talking to me won't change anything about the situation.
You understand that, right?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
侵食魔なんてのはいい加減おさらばしてえよな？
もちろん、黒騎士野郎もな
column2: Don't you think it's about time to say goodbye to the infected monsters? And the black knight too, of course.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
レオはよ――バカだよな
冷めた顔して、熱くなりすぎるんだ
あいつは昔からそうだったぜ
column2: Leo is such an idiot, isn't he? He always looks calm, but he gets too heated. He has been like that since forever.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 俺はもっと賑やかなところが好きだぜ
column2: I like it when it's more lively.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
人でも魔物でも構わねえ
その気になりゃいつでも大騒ぎできる程度に
相手がいるのがいいんだ
column2: It doesn't matter if they're human or monsters. It's good to have someone to make a big fuss with, whenever we feel like it.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
ここの連中の頭の固さはジョゼフ以上だが
悪い気はしねえな
連中なりに筋が通っている
column2: The stubbornness of these people here is greater than Joseph's, but I don't feel bad about it. They have their own way of doing things.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
――いや、ジョゼフのことをどうこう言ってる
わけじゃねえぞ
column2: -- No, I'm not talking about Joseph
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
聞いたところによると《原始の雫》は
そう簡単に手に入るシロモノじゃねえようだ
column2: According to what I heard, it seems that 《Primeval Drops》is not something that can easily be obtained
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
となると、相当な手練れじゃないと
無事の帰還は難しいと思うぜ
column2:
Then you'd have to be a pretty good hand to
make a safe return, I'd think.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺たちがもう少し早くこのフィンダムに
来ていればな――
そりゃいいっこ無しってか？
column2:
If only we'd come to Phindym a little earlier--
No more of that, huh?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
やっぱり俺はレスタニアの男だ
空気が鼻をスースー通ってくぜ
column2:
I'm a Lestanian man after all.
The air feels sooooooo good coming through my nose!
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
寝ても覚めても侵食魔退治よ
身体はキツいが気が楽っちゃあ楽だな
column2: Arisen, whether sleeping or awake, it's all about fighting the Infected. My body is tired, but my mind is at ease.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
しっかし、魔物ってのは尽きないよな
こいつらいったい何のためにいるんだとか
テツガク的なことも考えたくなるぜ
column2: Nevertheless, enemies never seem to run out, you know? I wonder what they're actually here for. It makes me want to think about it from a philosophical perspective.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
これで何もかも、トントン拍子に上手くいけば
いいんだがな
column2: If everything goes smoothly as planned, it would be good.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
敵ってのは、敵らしくあって欲しいぜ
憎らしくて、悪くてよ
column2: Enemies should be like enemies. Hateful and evil.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
もう少しここにいるぜ
行く末を見届けたくてよ
column2: I'll be here a little longer just to see where it all goes.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
また留守がちになると思って
部屋を引き払ったぜ
しばらくは宿暮らしだ
column2: I thought I would be gone frequently, so I left my room. I will be living in temporary accommodations for a while.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
絶望の大陸アッカーシェランか
でもよ、あのジリアンの目には
光があったよな
column2: Is it the Land of Despair, Acre Selund? But you know, in Gillian's eyes, there was light, wasn't there?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
王子は１２歳とか言ってたな
自分の頭で考えて行動できる年頃だ
column2: The prince said he was 12 years old; he should be old enough to think and act for himself.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
つまりジッとしてるわけじゃねえ
厄介っちゃあ厄介だな
column2: So, it's not like I'm just sitting still. It's troublesome, that's for sure.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
王子と一緒にいる盗賊ってのは
どんな連中だろうな
column2: I wonder what kind of bandits are with the prince.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
義賊みたいなやつらかそれとも
ただの山賊集団か――
column2: Those guys are like noble thieves, or maybe just a group of bandits -
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 敵は悪しき竜"だろ？
盗賊と王家の家臣が揉めている場合じゃねえ
――って言ってこいよ"
column2:
The enemy is an "Evil Dragon", right?
This is not the time for a fight between a bandit and a royal vassal.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺はオークだのなんだのを引き受けるから
王子は頼むぜ
column2:
I'll take care of the orcs and whatnot.
You take care of the prince.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
緩んでる場合じゃねえと思うけどよ
まあ、それは将軍たちが決めることだな
column2: I don't think it's the time to slack off, but well, that's something the generals decide.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
覚者になってからこっちずっとオークと
戦って鼻がバカになっちまったが
column2: Since I became an Arisen, I've been fighting Orcs all this time and now I'm getting all sniffly.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
アッカーシェランのオークの匂いは
また独特――新鮮な気分で戦えるぜ
column2: The scent of Acre Selund's Orcs is unique; it makes you feel refreshed and ready to fight.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
面倒な駆け引きはともかく
真っ向ぶつかり合いなら俺に任せろ
column2:
Ignoring the troublesome negotiations,
Leave it to me if it comes down to a direct confrontation.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 悪しき竜"の目的が自分の力を
誇示するためとは――"
column2: The purpose of the "Evil Dragon" is to demonstrate their own power.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: そりゃガキ大将の理屈じゃねえか
column2: That's a kid's theory, isn't it?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる
column2:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ
column2: Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you know.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
展望城のオークの数も見えてきたな
しかも少しずつだが、減っていやがる
column2:
I'm seeing the number of orcs in Lookout Castle
And they're getting fewer, little by little.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: ジリアンたち、いい仕事してるぜ
column2: Gillian and the others are doing a great job, you know.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 血がよ、ザワザワと沸くようだぜ
column2: My blood is boiling, man.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
メイロワ将軍のことだから次から次へと
作戦をぶち上げそうだな
column2: I'm sure General Meirova will be blasting out one operation after another.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 少し休ませろって話だ
column2: Time for a rest.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
チッ――何をしていても
真っ黒野郎のことを考えちまうぜ
column2: Damn--no matter what I do, I'm always thinking about that pitch black bastard.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
くそ――あれこれ雑念が多いな
このままじゃ目の前の敵に
集中できねえぞ
column2:
Damn--there's a lot of distractions.
I can't focus on the enemy in front of me if I keep going like this.
speaker: Gurdolin

old: 身体の調子はどうだ？
column2: How's your body feeling?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
俺らにも影響が出ないとは限らねえ
今のうちにやれることやっておかねえと
column2:
We can't be sure it won't affect us too.
We should do what we can while we can.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
気い抜くと――力も抜けるんだ
気張って行くぜ
column2:
When you let your mind wander... your strength will wander, too.
I'm going in strong.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
足手まといにならねえように
せいぜい気ぃ張るぜ
column2: I'll do my best not to be a liability
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
話しかけないでくれ
今の俺は憎悪の塊だぜ
column2:
Please don't talk to me.
I'm a bundle of hatred right now.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
あれやこれや、賭けときゃ良かったぜ
大儲けできたろうによ
column2:
You should have bet on this, that, and the other thing.
You could have made a fortune.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
そんなにひとりが良いなら
ひとりにしてやれよ――ってわけには
いかねえかぁ
column2:
If you like to be alone so much, leave him alone.
I don't know.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
これはなんとも歯がゆい状況だな
え？
column2: This is a very frustrating situation, isn't it?
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
心配事は性に合わねえ
俺は戦闘のあるところへ行かせて
もらうぜ
column2:
Worrying is not in my nature.
Let me go where the fighting is.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
まあ、こうなったら深いこと考えずに
ガスガスと前に進むしかねえよな
毎度のことだ
column2: Well, in this situation, there's nothing else to do but keep moving forward, with gusto. It's always the same thing.
speaker: Gurdolin

old:
寝るぞ――俺は――ああ、なんなら
十日くらいぶっ通しで眠ってやる
column2: I'm going to sleep ―― Oh, what the heck, I'll sleep for about ten days straight.
speaker: Gurdolin
